COMMENT_TX: Flied out after fouling off half-dozen pitches
All 3 drives to RF would've bounced off the wall in Cleveland
Yde dropped Gehringer's throw to first
Dropped a single on RF line
Way over the scoreboard; hit a front porch on Cherry Street
The throw home was dropped by Manion, allowing Heilmann to return to 3B, but Manion's attempt to catch Alexander off 2B was low, allowing Heilmann to score and the other runners to advance.
Over top tier of RF bleachers into Trumbull Avenue
Too hot for Melillo; caromed off his legs into RF
Heilmann fouled out trying to dodge an inside pitch
Bounded off the scoreboard into the street
Gehringer: nice play ranging far beyond 2B
Off Smith's glove, through the box
Weather: hazy and muggy following a morning rain that, for a time, threatened the game. Rhodes' 1st ML start
Durocher: fine pickup of hard smash
Pretty catch, reaching in one of the field boxes
Into vacant circus seats in RF (roped-off area was empty due to lower attendance than expected).
Over LF wall, into Cherry Street
Alexander: leaping stop of high bounder
Ruth: backhanded 1-hand catch near circus seats
Went to 2B on Ruth's slow play
To the vacant circus seats in RF
A heavy all-morning rain made the field soggy and patches of water stood in the outfield.
Simmons claimed he caught it but was ruled a trap
Haas: leaping catch at the scoreboard
DWS: missing bottom of 8th to end in DET192905140 The following events gleaned from Philadelphia Inquirer and Detroit Free Press:
$Schuble rounded 3B and started to scramble back to the bag but Billings was headed there, too.  In a wild run-down Schuble was able to dodge by Cochrane and score.
Not sure of scoring events this inning

$Heilmann came home standing up; Cochrane took the throw and made a lunging swipe at the runner, hitting him in the head. As Heilmann fell across the plate unconscious, Cochrane dropped the ball.  Physicians said Heilmann's injury was not serious.
Johnson slid under the throw home safely
Heilmann was trapped but returned to 3B safely
Box score showed Schuble batting 7th and Phillips 8th, but the narrative had the reverse, and Schuble usually batted 8th, so I chose the text version.
Reynolds went to 3B on Johnson's fumble, then scored on the latter's wild throw to the plate.
Reynolds interfered with Alexander catching a foul
Another brilliant catch of long fly to CF fence
Cissell ejected by McGowan for arguing strike call- not  clear if during or after at bat.
Rice fell chasing grass cutter; Ump McGowan said he trapped it
This account augmented by AP box in Pittsburgh Post-Gazette.
Slow bounder over the box; Smith threw past Alexander at 1B
O'Rourke dropped line drive; ruled a hit
Shea was injured on play at plate
Falk let it get away from him
Ball hit McManus and rolled into Tiger dugout
Gehringer tried to tag Earnshaw but the ball rolled to CF
Bounced over 3B; Hale thought it was foul and didn't throw it
Rice ejected by Ump Ormsby for disputing called strike.
$Fans booed during 11th inning without pause and swarmed on field at game's end.  Police reserves had to escort umpires and players from the field.
Ruthian blast over LCF scoreboard, striking a dwelling of the adjoining street.
Grove injured a pitching-hand finger here
IPHR; 'Hale shot a liner through Johnson's legs' Hale's only HR in '29
Gaston needs two WP in this game, assuming here for one
Morgan got both hands on it but couldn't hold on
Scratch hit off Ferrell's glove; Hodapp's bad knee buckled under him just when he was about to field it.
Fielding records for Detroit in CPD box score disagree with narrative for most of their players.

Game called on account of rain at 5:30 while Cleveland batted in the top of the 6th.
